attributes.action: reform British education by marking A levels using a percentile based scheme & doing away with A* grades, instead awarding the top 100 grades per exam with “Distinctions”.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Grade inflation is a serious problem with the A-level, with 95% of candidates getting passes. By moving to a percentile based marking system, those who get the best results will be more easily reported, whilst all will still be stretched. In addition, the creation of a flat number of “Distinctions” will allow higher education & industry to identify the best & brightest – but without wholesale & expensive change to the existing A-level system.
